attributes.action: FREE sanitary products for women with endometriosis
attributes.background: 1 in 10 women of reproductive age in the UK suffer from endometriosis. 10% of women world wide have endometriosis - that's 176 million worldwide. Women with endometriosis usually experience extremely heavy and painful periods and can go through as many as 20 night time pads in an average day.

attributes.action: Students doing history GCSE's should learn 5 units for History instead of 4.
attributes.background: I personally am a strong believer that GCSE's currently are just a test of memory, and the hardest working students should be segregated from those who's efforts are inadequate.
attributes.additional_details: From the information I have acquired from students doing the 2018 GCSE History examinations, doing 4 units of history was not challenging for them and the task was too easily completed. They knew that they were not being tested to their full potential of memorisation and would be interested in doing an extra unit. Additionally, a fifth unit would not only further test the exam skills of each candidate, but would also help in ensuring those who succeed are the very best and most hardworking.

attributes.action: Ban Smoking on streets
attributes.background: Smoking on the streets is bad for other people through passive smoking and the environment.
attributes.additional_details: It was proven that when the indoor smoking ban was brought into force over 700,000 people stopped smoking

attributes.action: Do not remain in the EEA
attributes.background:
Remaining in the EEA will stop the UK becoming the sovereign nation that was voted for in the referendum.
All the promises of new trade deals will become token at best.
Nations outside of the EU has warned against staying in the EU like this and we demand parliament does as was told by the people.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theaustralian.com.au/national-affairs/alexander-downer-warns-uk-of-irrelevancy-over-soft-brexit-plans/news-story/c967595695165c994395d81fbb91e100

attributes.action: Make 8th May 'Attenborough Day' - a bank holiday for visiting nature.
attributes.background: Sir David Attenborough is one of the greatest Britons of the past 100 years. Rather than putting him on a plastic bank note or a commemorative coin, mark his Birthday with a public holiday for getting into nature and cleaning up our environment.
attributes.additional_details: Doing good things, especially outside, makes people happier. Happier people make happier workers means greater production. Itâ€™s a win win.

attributes.action: Fund free travel on public transport for all students in England.
attributes.background: Students do not earn money and yet have to pay for travel. This is not fair and many cannot afford it. Students are normally travelling to school/ college and shouldn't have to pay for this. This is why we feel that all students should have free travel and we urge you to sign it.

attributes.action: Continue benefit payments while processing Universal Credit
attributes.background: UC is the total of all benefits that a person will claim. Once UC has been processed, and the amount payable is known, then deduct or add accordingly HB/CT/ESA etc. with the remainder being the claimant's entitlement. This will prevent risking lives/ homes or the need for food banks in the meantime.

attributes.action: UK Government to work with the devolved assemblies to create UK free bus travel
attributes.background: Those who are 60 years and over can get free bus travel in Wales Scotland Northern Ireland and London while the rest of UK citizens have to pay. This surely is unfair on those of us who rely on bus travel for work and leisure in England. Please sign this petition to bring in a national standard
attributes.additional_details: Many people aged 60 and over struggle to pay the cost of bus travel. It makes sense to bring in a UK standard for all .This would also help with road congestion and therefore help to reduce pollution from car emissions. It should also improve bus services due to the extra demand by this age group.  Many other countries  actively promote the use of public transport to free up congested roads especially with  Hydrogen and Electric powered public transport.Cleaner air makes  a better environment

attributes.action: An accepted offer on a house is a binding contract, withdrawal incurs 5% penalty
attributes.background: When we bought our house, the vendor withdrew at the last minute and selling our current house, more than one buyer withdrew at the last minute and in each case, leaving us with considerable inconvenience and unforeseen financial consequences. This will stop chains collapsing.

attributes.action: All local authorities should recycle all plastic
attributes.background: Torridge and West Devon do not currently allow recycling of anything other than plastic bottles. All other plastic is sent to landfill. In a joined up world how can it be that other Councils can recycle all plastic and others can only recycle some.
attributes.additional_details: Surely we should have a joined up approach to recycling ALL waste, particularly all plastic. Each council should adhere to a national recycling standard where all plastic is sent to be recycled. Economies of scale would make this more feasible rather than individual councils negotiating their own recycling schemes.

attributes.action: Allow Pubs/Clubs to have their own policy on tobacco consumption
attributes.background: The blanket ban on smoking in pubs and clubs is illiberal in a society that time and time again calls itself as a free one. There should be a removal of smoking bans in pubs, and the proprietors/owners themselves should be allowed to set their own policies for their own property.
attributes.additional_details: A society that values private property, freedom of choice and enterprise cannot simply impose a blanket ban, such as the ban on smoking in Pubs. This petition is designed to allow parliament to debate the effectiveness of each landlord being able to declare their pub as smoking/non-smoking as they see fit, with the same consequences and restrictions for those who smoke in non-smoking pubs as exist today.

attributes.action: Allow ESA / UC claimants to only go a maximum of 4 weeks without payment.
attributes.background: Employment Support Allowance / Universal credit in many cases is there to provide financial help to those who are unable to work due to physical / mental health conditions. During considerations, assessments and appeals etc. payments can unfortunately be put on hold for long periods of time.
attributes.additional_details: The whole process causes a lot of unnecessary stress and financial strain to those affected. The time frame for this should be limited to 4 weeks maximum, as currently in many cases this can be ongoing for months when there is no need for it to take this long.

attributes.action: Offer free paediatric and adult first aid courses
attributes.background: Currently, first aid courses can prove quite expensive. When faced with someone in need, many don't have the confidence or knowledge to give first aid. Free courses can provide everyone with the skills and mentality, and allow them to be able to assist with first aid when needed.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 5 people will be faced with someone who needs immediate cpr throughout their lives, yet only 39% say they are able to perform cpr. Every minute that passes increases mortality. By offering these courses It allows those who may not have the confidence, knowledge or funding to be able to intervene in situations where lives are at risk, and hopefully, make a difference.

attributes.action: Extend the maximum length of a caravan towed by a 3.5 tonne vehicle from 7m
attributes.background: The current law stops you towing a caravan more than 7m long with anything less than 3.5 tonne vehicle when a lot of vehicles less than 3.5 tonne are capable of towing these caravans
attributes.additional_details: There seems to be more and more caravans now especially foreign caravans that are more than 7m long these can currently only be towed with a vehicle more than 3.5 tonne a lot of people still tow illegally with less than 3.5 tonne as most campsites donâ€™t allow Comercial vehicles so this makes it hard to stay legal and still be able to enjoy using bigger family friendly caravans

attributes.action: Make it law for all restaurants to provide Braille menus.
attributes.background: Why should people not have the option to read a menu? Perhaps it's something that we sighted people take for granted. In order for visually impaired people to gain more independence, it's important that they're actually able to read a menu for themselves.

attributes.action: Stop childcare providers charging parents when they are closed or have holiday.
attributes.background: This is a petition to stop parents being held to ransom by childcare providers! Currently nurseries/child minders are allowed to charge parents up to a full days rate for care when they are closed for bank holidays, staff training and xmas. Resulting in working parents taking holiday or upaid leave.

attributes.action: Introduce National Conscription with the opportunity to volunteer overeseas.
attributes.background: It seems it would be more constructive to direct school leavers at 16 or 18 to have the opportunity to be part of a group who provide the opportunity to engage in social positive role model building than to be unemployed and idle when so much help is needed across society. A better use of gov money.
attributes.additional_details: Knife crime, scooter mugging, drug taking and obesity are all escalating issues amongst young people both as perpetrators and victims. National Conscription for one year with the opporuntiy to volunteer abroad could be such a constructive initiative following the lead of Norway, Denmark and Israel - three of the happiest, most disciplined, best-educated countries in the world. Germany, France and Italy are considering something similar.

attributes.action: Revisit the NHS Pay Deal 2018 as the initial communications were misleading
attributes.background: The detail released to NHS staff and Unions from NHS Employers was misleading and staff and unions have voted based on the information initially provided. This has resulted in large numbers of staff not receiving a 6% pay increase over 3 years as communicated.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on the UK remaining/leaving the Customs Union
attributes.background: In 2016 the British people voted to leave the EU . However thereâ€™s still no consensus on what form a Brexit can take which has caused much conflict on issues like trade and the Irish border .A simple solution would be to allow the electorate to decide if we leave or remain in the Customs Union.

attributes.action: Food labelling re sugar to simple & straight forward for all
attributes.background:
I believe all foodstuffs should just have a picture of a spoon of  sugar with a number on it denoting the amount in total in that product.
There are too many guises for sugar that consumers do not understand.

attributes.action: Beat corporate tax avoidance by introducing Sales Tax based on Delivery Address
attributes.background: Big companies like Amazon, with turnovers in the UK in the billions, get away with paying next to no corporation tax.  Introduce a Delivery Sales Tax, based on the postcode being delivered to.  Claw back this money which is currently flowing overseas.  We could do this by monitoring at the courier.
attributes.additional_details:
It would be simple to legislate to require delivery companies to keep a log of:

a) Origin Company
b) Delivery Postcode
c) Declared value of item
d) Unique Shipping ID

Issue each company with an annual tax bill based on a fair percentage of the total value of all items delivered in the UK.

Failure to declare adequate value of a package would invalidate its insurance.

Spot checks would be simple - make occasional test orders to random addresses.  Incorrect declarations would be fined harshly.

attributes.action: Give the parents of twins or multiples maternity leave per child
attributes.background: Currently the parents of twins, triplets, quads etc. Only receive one years maternity leave for one parent. We feel parents should receive maternity leave per child.

attributes.action: The cost of a colour TV licence should be cut to Â£100.
attributes.background:
BBC news and current affairs programmes are no longer of high quality.
In an age of austerity where ordinary people are struggling to make ends meet, a licence fee of Â£150 is no longer justified for substandard broadcasting.
attributes.additional_details:
As a national broadcaster, the BBC is expected to be fearless, objective and impartial in its reporting of news and current affairs programming.
The BBC often avoids or downplays politically sensitive news items, allows statements to go unchallenged and uses false equivalence to counter balance expert opinion.
These are not the attributes expected of a national broadcaster in a leading democratic nation.

attributes.action: Amend child maintenance rules to ensure benefits to the child
attributes.background: There are currently no CSA/DWP guidelines which govern how child maintenance payments are used by the resident parent.  Rules should be introduced to ensure child maintenance payments are used fairly & reasonably for the benefit of the child and not solely for the benefit of the resident parent.
attributes.additional_details: This principle can be achieved by allowing the non-res parent to purchase a pre-defined list of items if not provided by the res parent (e.g. school uniforms/shoes/dinner money/trips, basic clothing needs, public transport fares for travel to/from college, etc.) and to deduct the cost of such items from the amount of CM payable subject to provision of receipts. The res parent could still take action if they believed that deductions were being made unreasonably or outside the CSA/DWP guidelines.

attributes.action: The practice of unsolicited credit limit increases should be banned.
attributes.background: The Financial Conduct Authority has limited the use of unsolicited credit card limit increases, but it is not enough. There are still people actively being given these when there is no hope of them paying them off if they used them.
attributes.additional_details:
The FCA reports: "Our analysis of 2014 data showed that receiving a credit limit increase is associated with an increase in spending, with accounts that received a credit limit increase having an average balance Â£458 higher at the end of the year. The average credit limit increase was Â£1,321."

The finance industry is therefore actively encouraging people to spend more money and get further into debt. 

https://www.fca.org.uk/publication/consultation/cp17-43.pdf

attributes.action: Emergency services to be exempt from parking tickets or charges while on duty.
attributes.background:
Emergency services to be exempt from parking tickets or charges.

Lights and/or siren not required to be active for exemption.

Only requirement is for staff to be on duty (on call) but not restricted to being on a call and is to include brake times.
attributes.additional_details: www.express.co.uk/news/uk/993969/parking-warden-ticket-paramedics-north-west-ambulance-service/amp

attributes.action: Raise  Housing Benefits in accordance with Market Prices
attributes.background: The benefits system offers a miserly level of rent , expecting recipients to  manage in a housing market with prices far outstripping the benefit available.
attributes.additional_details: It is virtually impossible to find a home at the price the government claims is available for renting. Recipients are penalised for renting a place with two beds, even when one beds are limited, and many people cannot meet the cost of rent in this country. This is forcing many people into homelessness and rewarding greedy private landlords, while many renters are trying to meet excess costs out of their limited finances. Market value is not being taken into account where Housing Benefits are concerned.  Social Housing and cheap, good homes are not available, and market costs are ridiculously high, resulting in a dismal market, and a head in the clouds response from the government in tackling the housing crisis on all levels. Raise the level of Housing Benefit in line with the market.

attributes.action: law to put panic buttons in hgv s incase drivers have medical emergency
attributes.background: Lots of drivers going missing and when found are deceased in their cabs, either unable to raise alarm of feeling unwell or no signal on phone etc

attributes.action: Alll people charged with a sexual offence against children remanded in custody.
attributes.background: Children are our future. The most valuable people in society. If the CPS deems enough evidence to charge offenders exist, that means they are a danger to all children. Which means they should be on remand until their court case. No bail can circumvent this risk. No prison spaces? Build new prisons.

attributes.action: Keep Domesticated Animals in Travelling Circuses
attributes.background: Domesticated Animals in Travelling Circuses are only allowed by certain Councils at the moment. Because you mention a Circus has Animals in it certain Councils want to Ban them i hope my Petition will stop this from happening and let this tradition continue
attributes.additional_details: Domesticated Animals in Travelling Circuses could range from Dogs, Cats to Budgies and Horses that come from Outside the UK that forms part of a Travelling Circuses Act and will only be allowed if the Animals coming into the UK have been Inspected by the RSPCA/SSPCA etc and only then will Horses from outside be allowed in Travelling Circuses.

attributes.action: Place a price ceiling on the cost of therapeutic oxygen for inflight use.
attributes.background: I suffer from a collection of  congenital heart defects which means that I require the use of therapeutic oxygen when I fly on an aircraft. The cost of this is upwards from Â£50 per flight. Some airlines ask you to provide your own oxygen through a private company which costs around Â£300 per week.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe that the travel industry is capitalising on peoples illnesses, and receiving a huge profit on the sale of therapeutic oxygen, which is essential a bottle of air, as medical grade oxygen is available to purchase for Â£6.64 on the BOC website. 
https://www.boconline.co.uk/shop/en/uk/healthcare/medical-gas/oxygen-cylinder-medical-grade-compressed-gas
 I am calling for a price limit to be placed on therapeutic inflight oxygen as it is unfair for the industry to make money off my illness.

attributes.action: Make cyclists require a cycling licence that they must carry at all times.
attributes.background: I have nearly been hit three times by cyclists going at high speed around corners. Cyclists never use bells anymore so silently sneak up on you and shoot past (on the pavement).
attributes.additional_details: Many people have called for regulation of cycling. This has been impractical as bikes do not need reg numbers (like cars) but this proposal is new. I propose that cyclists themselves should have to purchase a licence from the DVLA which can be revoked if guilty of dangerous cycling.

attributes.action: Create a government virtual address for homeless people to use as fixed abode.
attributes.background: Homeless people are prevented from progressing with services and employment opportunities due to no fixed address.

attributes.action: Require all supermarkets to have an Eco packaging/Local produce/Vegan section
attributes.background: People know of the harm that use of plastic/meat and dairy industry/food flown thousands of miles is having on the planet and are doing all they can, but options are limited and that makes people feel there's not much they can help with. So with this petition we require ALL supermarkets to have:
attributes.additional_details:
1.ECO Section: include zero- plastic products - 'naked' veg and fruit; grains, bread, pasta, spices packaged in paper; milk, oils, juices in glass bottles; toiletries - solid shampoos, conditioners, toothpaste, deodorants
 
2.Local Produce Section: to reduce carbon footprint of our shopping, consumers should be able to easily find products grown locally.
 
3.Increase vegan produce at least two-fold, stocking a reasonable selection in local stores as well, giving eco friendly options to everyone

attributes.action: Fund Carbon removal factories CDC & DAC in the UK powered by renewable energy.
attributes.background: Carbon pollution is acidifying our oceans, killing our wildlife and destroying our planet. This is unacceptable considering technology already exists that can extract Carbon from the atmosphere. Carbon Dioxide Removal (CDC) and Direct Air Capture (DAC) can catch 1 million tons of CO2 per year.
attributes.additional_details: Right now there is technology known as "Carbon Dioxide Removal (CDC)" and "Direct Air Capture (DAC)" that can remove carbon from our atmosphere. If this technology was rolled out on a national scale it will save lives, it will improve our Air. Powered by Renewable energies evidence suggests this tech could capture 1 million tons of CO2 Per Year. Recent studies show 1 in 6 deaths are linked to all forms of pollution in the UK. This is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Require sanctions for breaches of the Ministerial Code
attributes.background: Ministers breaking the ministerial code result in a report describing the breach - action may not be taken. The code should be given some force e.g. minor technical breach - an apology to Parliament: Deliberate major breach - a lifetime ban on being a Minister.
attributes.additional_details: In cases where it is found there has been a deliberate major breach, the individual, and any other who behaved similarly, could not be relied upon to abide by the code in future and would therefore be unfit to be a Minister. A right of appeal to a court should exist in the event of such a sanction.

attributes.action: Change the UK voting system to a legal requirement to increase voting turnout
attributes.background: Making voting a legal requirement will increase the turnout, making more uk citizens happier with the results. Currently, only 60% of the registered voters take part, which leaves 40% unhappy with the turnout as that have not cast a vote. We would like to change this and make voting compulsory.

attributes.action: To allow funeral processions to use all Bus Lanes.
attributes.background: I am a Funeral Director based in South London Area and in my time of conducting funerals i have found that traffic in London is terrible. Although we do our very best on planning funerals and always allowing extra time, you can never anticipate 100% on what traffic will be like during your journey.
attributes.additional_details: I strongly believe that i speak on behalf of all funeral directors and families that have been late to lay their loved ones to rest because we have been caught in unexpected traffic. It will ease the worry on so many levels and keep the dignity to the end. Having use of bus lanes, im my opinion and experience, will substantially lower the chances of ourselves, our grieving families and any member of our community being late for the most important journey in our lifetime.....our final one!

attributes.action: Amend Microchip Regulations to require chip alerts for stolen dogs when scanned
attributes.background:
There is no method to raise an alert (where the dog is stolen) when a dog is scanned by a vet or authorised person.
When the data operators records show the dog as stolen, an alert should be made to the individual operating the microchip scanner to alert them to such. Confiscation laws introduced.
attributes.additional_details:
When a dog is scanned (i.e. by a veterinary practice) the only information being provided through the scanner is the microchip number. If the information included alert data which was recorded by the data operator, provided by the true keeper, this could help with the recovery of stolen dogs.
Police / RSPCA officers etc should be given scanners to support this and enable them to scan when they identify potentially vulnerable dogs.

attributes.action: Increase limit for when charities must have an independent review of accounts
attributes.background: I am involved with a charity which makes approximately Â£25-Â£30k per year, meaning we must have an independent review.  This cost us Â£2500 this year, which seems a disproportionately high percentage of our income.   Increasing the limit to Â£50k could help charities give more to the causes we support.
attributes.additional_details: According to gov.uk, there were approximately 58 thousand charities in the UK with income between Â£10k and Â£100k.  If we assume that these are evenly distributed across the range, around 16000 charities would benefit.  If their costs are similar to ours, that would be an extra Â£45k going to good cause each year.  While transparency is important, people give to small charities assuming the money goes to the cause they promote and 10% going to an auditor does not serve their expectations well.

attributes.action: Make all goods vehicles to have speed limiters set at the national speed limit
attributes.background: Legislation needs to be in place making all goods vehicles speed limiters set at the national speed limit in order to reduce overtaking . At present hauliers set their vehicles at a speed of their choice. This causes bunching of LGV's and causes unnecessary overtaking .

attributes.action: Make it unlawful for social/news outlets to host any material of any child abuse
attributes.background: Failing to censor this material on platforms that are at so many peoplesâ€™ fingertips normalises this behaviour and perpetuates child abuse. Social and news medias have a responsibility to protect the vulnerable. These platforms must stop putting revenue before child safety by reporting and censoring
attributes.additional_details: Recent channel 4 Dispatches found that Facebook's moderators were not removing child physical abuse images from its platform, they merely place a warning on the images. Similarly, the mail online recently showed a graphic video of a mother beating her twins for profit. It is my belief that by leaving this kind of footage on media, whereby you neednâ€™t seek it out, desensitises the public, normalises this behaviour and justifies mimicking. Any abuse of children should be taken as seriously as sex abuse

attributes.action: Make the penalties for breaking election rules far stronger
attributes.background:
Vote Leave breaking electoral law in the referendum is the latest in a string of electoral scandals. 

The fines are so small as to be seen as a reasonable cost to parties and campaign groups. Penalties should include greater fines, prison and even annulment of results.

attributes.action: Lower Company Car Tax (BIK) on all company cars
attributes.background: Fewer people are now paying company car tax but the Government takes in excess of Â£360m extra revenue,funds from company car drivers has increased by 24% each year. WLTP is going to make some cars go up in bandings despite the EU dictating that the driver should not have to pay more until April2020.
attributes.additional_details: The latest figures published in fleet news is bad news for company car drivers and car dealers alike.  Drivers have seen tax hikes like no other and are often middle earners, not high earners.

attributes.action: Parents must be told if the other parent is convicted of child sex offenses
attributes.background: Parents must be told if their ex is convicted of child sex offenses, even if they donâ€™t have contact with the children at that time.

attributes.action: 6 points on the persons driving licence if caught leaving a dog in a hot car
attributes.background: People who leave their dogs in baking hot cars should be disciplined with 6 points on their driving licence and reported directly to the RSPCA.

attributes.action: Stop long distance live animal transport for fattening or slaughter to/from UK.
attributes.background: This topic has been petitioned before and finished in March 2018.  I would like the topic to be kept in the public eye and to remind the appropriate government departments (Trade and industry / Farming and Agriculture) do not let this important issue to slip through the net.

attributes.action: Withdraw the sovereignty of the U.S embassy & send the U.S ambassadors home
attributes.background: In light of the atrocities carried out by Donald Trump's administration in the name of "strong borders" we must not tolerate the human rights abuses carried out against migrant children and their families, it is clear we must cut all ties with America.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is evidence of the crimes against immigrants held in detention centres.
https://www.thecut.com/2018/06/immigrant-children-detention-center-separated-parents.html
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/us-politics/us-immigration-children-audio-trump-border-patrol-separate-families-parents-detention-center-a8405501.html
https://www.thecut.com/2018/06/immigrant-children-allegedly-drugged-abused-in-shelters.html
What is happening to these children and their families is abhorrent.

attributes.action:
Allow a 
Referendum on changing the House Of Lords to a fully Elected Chamber
attributes.background: Abolition of the House of Lords has been debated. No clear way forward to address peopleâ€™s concerns was forthcoming; though their was some acknowledgement of it overstepping itâ€™s remit, particularly to thwart the peopleâ€™s decision for Brexit. The chamber needs to better reflect peopleâ€™s wishes.
attributes.additional_details: An elected chamber, drawn from all walks of life and being fully representative of the electorate should replace the current system. There should not be allowed to be overwhelming numbers from one particular political party or persuasion. Elected members should not need to be past MPs and could be experts in their field - elected to scrutinise in particular areas. People need to be able to trust that the powers given to scrutinise are not abused, nor guided by personal agenda or preference.

attributes.action: Support the 'Campaign Against Nurdle Spills' to regulate nurdle handling
attributes.background: Nurdles are small plastic pellets used in the production of plastic products.  Due to poor handling and lack of regulation, nurdles have become a huge source of pollution to our oceans and waterways.  Visit https://cans.blog to see more.
attributes.additional_details: Once spilt into marine environments nurdles absorb toxic chemicals and pose an immediate danger to wildlife as their size makes them easily mistaken for food.  The 'Campaign Against Nurdle Spills' has written a piece of secondary legislation that specifies methods to regulate all nurdle handling in the UK and UK waters.  This legislation will force anyone handling over 2KG of nurdles to be registered and agree to the highest standards of care when handling nurdles.
